passages.text: China (PRC) | Consumer Staples Mengniu

Mengniu's 1H25 results were weak, dragged by subdued consumer demand in UHT liquid milk and CMD's loss. Mgmt downgraded 2025 full- year revenue guidance. Mgmt indicated a slower industry recovery for consumer demand and less of a festival momentum effect for 3Q. PT cut to HK\$24.3. Maintain Buy.

Revenue decreased by \(6.9\%\) YoY, dragged by liquid milk's drop of \(11.2\%\) YoY (vol - \(60\%\) , ASP - \(40\%\) ; a narrower drop for 2Q than 1Q), mainly because of weaker- than- expected consumer demand, especially for UHT liquid milk. GPM of \(41.7\%\) expanded by 1.5pct YoY, primarily because of the favorable trend of raw milk. OPM came in at \(8.5\%\) , with a significant improvement of 1.5pct YoY, thanks to GPM expansion and S&D expense control. Net profit dropped by \(16.4\%\) YoY, due to CMD's loss of Rmb585mn in 1H25.

Mgmt downgraded 2025 full- year revenue guidance at the 1H25 analyst meeting. Mgmt expects a MSD- HSD% drop in revenue in 2025 (vs prior guidance: +LSD% growth in revenue). OPM is expected to remain stable in 2025, with an average expansion of 30- 50bps p.a. for the next three years, based on: 1) product category optimization and expecting non- UHT categories' OPM above UHT in 2- 3 years; 2) disciplined control in S&D expense, and 3) refined mgmt in supply chain cost and expense mgmt.
Raw milk price trend: Mgmt expects 2H25 raw milk to carry on a decreasing trend YoY and a flat trend HoH.

Jul- Aug trading update: During the meeting, management said it expected liquid milk to follow a similar trend to 2Q. Management also indicated a slower- than- expected industry recovery for consumer demand and less of a festival momentum effect in 3Q.

New share repo program announced: Mgmt will continue to implement a share repo program for the next 12 months with no less than the scale of repo conducted in the previous 12 months ( \(\sim\) HK\$500mn).
CFO resignation: Having reached retirement age, Mr Zhang will step down as CFO effective 1 September.

Model revisions: In this update, we trim our earnings estimates by \(5 - 11\%\) for 2025- 27E to factor in \(1\) soft consumer demand in liquid milk; 2) mgmt's updated 2025 guidance, 3) CMD's loss. Less Capex (vs last update); and 5) stable dividend policy. PT cut to HK\$24.3, implying \(>16\%\) potential upside. Maintain Buy as we like Mengniu's leading position in premium UHT liquid milk, its diversified product portfolio, and mgmt's solid execution.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 4 - 9 of this report. \\* Jefferies Hong Kong Limited

Chart 1 - Raw milk price down by \(10.6\%\) YTD, stabilizing gradually; mgmt expects 2H25 raw milk to show a decreasing trend YoY and a flat trend vs 1H25

- Mengniu ranked No.2 in China's dairy market by sales according to the "Global Dairy Top 20" list published by Rabobank in 2021. It has leading brands in most dairy product segments.- Management is focusing on Route to Market (RTM) reform, cost control, and digitalisation transformation, and we believe these measures will enhance its competitiveness and drive long-term growth. Fresh milk and cheese could be the next growth drivers.- We expect the IMF business to remain a drag on the company's growth but remain positive on its other dairy businesses.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

Stable macro environment. Dairy sales volume increases by MSD% to HSD% in the next few years. Consumers trade up to premium products. Competition remains at a normalized level over the next three years.
- Raw milk price slight -ive in 2025.- Mengniu changes its product mix by increasing sales of room-temperature high-end milk, fresh milk, and cheese.- DCF-based PT of HK\$24.3.

- Macro environment is better than our base case expectations. Dairy sales volume growth accelerates to double-digit%. Competition eases over the next three years, with more small dairy companies exiting the market.- Mengniu raises product prices by mid-to high-single-digit%- Mengniu becomes a leading player in fresh milk. It scales up sales of baby food, organic products, and infant formula, helped by the acquisition of Bellamy's.- DCF-based PT of HK\$30.0.

- Dairy sales vol growth decelerates or declines due to a weaker-than-expected macro environment. Consumers trade down to lower-end products. Competition intensifies between Mengniu and Yili, leading to heavy price competition.- Costs increase significantly on raw material price inflation and Mengniu is unable to pass on the rising costs due to intensifying competition.- Demand for Mengniu's high-end products is weaker than expected. Bellamy's continues to report declining sales and profit, leading to further goodwill/trademark value impairment.- DCF-based PT of HK\$12.0.

Top Material Issue(s)1) Food safety. Maintaining product quality and safety is crucial for Mengniu, as dairy products are sold directly to consumers. Quality control is needed and potential negative events such as product recalls could harm its brand image. 2) Supply chain management is important given reliance on contract farmers and suppliers. 3) Environmental and social impacts, including deforestation, land use, animal welfare, etc, are also critical.

Company Target(s): Carbon peak in 2030 and carbon neutrality in 2050 via three phases: 1) To control the carbon emission intensity per tonne of dairy product within 165 kgCO2e/t in 2025. 2) To achieve the peak in absolute value of Scope 1 and 2 carbon emissions, and keep the carbon emission intensity per tonne of dairy product within 160 kgCO2e/t in 2030. 3) To achieve the carbon neutrality of Scope 1, 2, and 3 in 2050.

Qs to Mgmt: 1) On supply chain management, how do you ensure your suppliers comply with your environmental management requirements and ensure product quality? 2) How much do you expect to spend to achieve your medium- to long- term ESG targets?
- Better-than-expected consumer demand in liquid milk- Share repo program- Dividend payout ratio increase- Raw milk price turnaround- Price hikes in dairy products- M&A activities

MengniuMengniu Dairy is one of the biggest dairy product manufacturers in China by sales. It mainly manufactures and distributes liquid milk (such as UHT milk, milk beverages, and yogurt), ice cream, milk formula, and other products (such as plant- based protein beverages and cheese). Its major brands include Milk Deluxe, Just Yoghurt, Champion, Yashily, and Dumex. The company distributes its products nationwide and overseas. At the end of 2018, it had annual production capacity of 9.75 million tons. The company was listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in 2004.

We value Mengniu based on a fundamental DCF approach, factoring in a discount rate of \(9.5\%\) ( \(3.9\%\) risk- free rate, \(5.6\%\) equity premium, \(1.0x\) beta, debt- free capital structure) and a terminal growth rate of \(2\%\) . Risks to our price target include intensified competition, goodwill/trademark value impairment on milk powder business, management changes, unsuccessful M&A consolidation, and food safety issues.
Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company. NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations. Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
